title: HDFC Bank announces 15% dividend, board approves stock buyback
body: HDFC Bank today declared a 15% dividend for shareholders and the board also approved a stock buyback programme worth Rs 10,000 crore, signalling confidence in its capital position and future growth.

title: HDFC Bank board clears buyback, 15% dividend for FY25
body: The board of HDFC Bank has cleared a share buyback of up to Rs 10,000 crore and recommended a 15% dividend for FY25. Management said the payout reflects strong profitability and comfortable capital ratios.

title: RBI raises repo rate by 25bps to 6.75%, citing inflation concerns
body: The Reserve Bank of India has raised the key policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 6.75 percent, highlighting rising food and fuel inflation as the main risks to its inflation trajectory.

title: Central bank hikes policy rate by 25bps, signals hawkish stance
body: India’s central bank increased the policy rate by 25 basis points and signalled a hawkish stance, saying further action will depend on how inflation and growth evolve in coming quarters.

title: ICICI Bank opens 500 new branches across Tier-2 cities
body: ICICI Bank announced the opening of 500 new branches across Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities to expand its retail presence and deepen its penetration in semi-urban markets.

title: Banking sector NPAs decline to 5-year low, credit growth at 16%
body: Non-performing assets in the banking sector fell to a five-year low while credit growth accelerated to 16 percent, according to RBI data, indicating a healthier balance sheet for banks.

title: NPAs hit 5-year low as banks clean up books; credit growth robust
body: Fresh slippages have moderated and recoveries improved, pushing banking sector NPAs to a five-year low. Robust loan demand has kept overall credit growth in double digits.

title: Infosys signs $2 billion AI and cloud deal with US retailer
body: Infosys has signed a multi-year $2 billion AI and cloud services deal with a large US-based retail chain, boosting its order book and strengthening its position in digital transformation deals.

title: Global retailer awards $2 billion digital transformation contract to Infosys
body: A global big-box retailer has chosen Infosys as its strategic partner for a $2 billion digital transformation programme focused on AI, analytics and cloud migration over the next five years.

title: Government announces fresh capital infusion for PSU banks
body: The finance ministry approved a fresh round of capital infusion into select public sector banks to support credit growth and meet Basel III capital requirements.

title: PSU bank recapitalisation package aimed at supporting lending to MSMEs
body: The government’s PSU bank recapitalisation plan is expected to improve lending capacity to MSMEs and infrastructure projects, according to officials familiar with the matter.

title: Retail inflation eases but remains above RBI comfort zone
body: India’s retail inflation cooled marginally in August but remained above the RBI’s medium-term target, keeping the door open for further policy tightening if price pressures persist.

title: CPI inflation moderates; central bank likely to stay cautious
body: Headline CPI moderated due to lower vegetable prices, but sticky core inflation means the central bank is unlikely to pivot to rate cuts in the near term.

title: Global IT spending expected to slow as clients optimise costs
body: Analysts expect global IT spending growth to slow as enterprises focus on cost optimisation and cloud efficiency, which could impact deal pipelines for Indian IT services firms.

title: BFSI clients tighten tech budgets; large IT deals may be delayed
body: Several BFSI clients are reportedly tightening technology budgets amid macro uncertainty, which could delay decision making on large multi-year outsourcing contracts.

title: SEBI proposes tighter margin norms for intraday traders
body: Market regulator SEBI has proposed tighter margin requirements for intraday trading to curb excessive leverage and protect retail investors from sharp market swings.

title: Brokerage stocks fall as SEBI eyes new leverage rules
body: Shares of discount brokerages fell after SEBI released a consultation paper proposing stricter leverage rules and higher margins for intraday products.

title: Government boosts capex allocation for roads and railways
body: The Union government announced a higher capital expenditure outlay for roads, railways and metro projects, which is expected to benefit infra and construction companies.

title: Infra stocks rally on higher budgeted spending for highways
body: Infra and EPC stocks rallied after the budget earmarked a larger allocation for national highway projects and logistics infrastructure.

title: Crude oil surges above $95 on supply concerns
body: Crude oil prices climbed above $95 per barrel as supply cuts by major producers and geopolitical tensions stoked concerns about tight markets.

title: High crude prices may pressure margins of paint and OMC companies
body: Analysts warned that sustained high crude prices could weigh on margins for paint makers and oil marketing companies unless price hikes are passed on to consumers.

title: Rupee strengthens on robust FII inflows, trades near 82.5 per dollar
body: The Indian rupee appreciated against the US dollar, supported by strong foreign institutional investor inflows into domestic equities and debt.

title: Exporters hedge aggressively as rupee gains; IT stocks underperform
body: IT exporters increased their hedging activity as the rupee strengthened, while IT stocks underperformed the broader market on concerns over currency headwinds.

title: Passenger vehicle sales grow 12% YoY in festive-led quarter
body: Passenger vehicle sales rose 12 percent year-on-year driven by strong festive demand, new model launches and easing supply constraints.

title: EV adoption accelerates as automakers launch affordable models
body: Electric vehicle adoption in India is picking up pace as automakers introduce more affordable EV models and charging infrastructure gradually improves.

title: Rural demand shows early signs of recovery, say FMCG companies
body: Leading FMCG companies indicated that rural demand is showing initial signs of recovery helped by government support schemes and moderating inflation.

title: Normal monsoon expected to aid rural consumption, benefit FMCG sector
body: A near-normal monsoon is likely to support farm incomes and boost rural consumption, which could benefit FMCG and consumer discretionary companies.

title: RBI issues guidelines on unsecured retail loans, NBFCs to reassess growth plans
body: The Reserve Bank of India issued fresh guidelines on unsecured retail lending, prompting several NBFCs to revisit their growth and underwriting strategies.

title: Tighter norms for unsecured loans may cool growth in personal finance segment
body: Analysts expect loan growth in the personal finance segment to moderate as tighter regulatory norms raise risk weights and capital requirements.

title: US tech stocks rally as Nasdaq hits new high
body: US technology stocks rallied sharply, lifting the Nasdaq to a new all-time high on optimism around AI spending and resilient corporate earnings.

title: Indian IT ADRs gain on Wall Street tech rally
body: ADRs of Indian IT majors including Infosys and TCS gained on Wall Street following a strong rally in US tech stocks.

title: UPI transactions hit fresh record high in August
body: UPI payments volume hit a new record high in August, underscoring continued growth in India’s digital payments ecosystem and benefitting banks and fintech players alike.

title: Fintechs eye profitability as customer acquisition costs fall
body: Several fintech companies are guiding for improved profitability as customer acquisition costs fall and cross-sell of lending and investment products picks up.
